4428031/4370015/4475158.title: Cure for Stye in the Eye - An Infallible Cure
4428031/4370015/4475158.text: Get a gooseberry bramble and fasting, take one thorn off each morning for nine mornings and point it towards the eye nine times each morning making the sign of the cross and saying each time you make the sign of the cross, In the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Ghost.

4428281/4391551/4479112.text: Convulsions.If a child takes the convulsions, get a person who never saw anyone in them to pull three blades of grass and put them over the child. 4481725/4408559/4481781.title: The Cure for a Styne (Stye)
4481725/4408559/4481781.text: The cure for a styne which is in an ulcer on the edge of the eye lid is a remarkable one. Nine jags are picked from a gooseberry bush and eight of them are pointed at the eye stye. The ninth one is thrown over the left shoulder of the person giving the cure.

4493706/4412842/4528505.title: Folk Cures and Charms - Stye on the Eye
4493706/4412842/4528505.text:
Nine gooseberry thorns were gathered. The patient then gave his stye a prick with each of the nine, and when finished with the ninth he threw it over his right shoulder. Then he commenced again with right and threw the eighth over his right shoulder when finished with it. Likewise with the seven remaining, then six, five [?] until the last one has been thrown away.

4605949/4605119/4644125.text:

Warts.The following are the cures for warts which can be made by any body. Ten straws are got one is thrown away across the right shoulder and the other nine are left safely away and by the time the straws are rotten the warts are gone. There is also another cure for warts. If accidentally a person meets water in a stone and washes the warts three times in the stone it is said that the warts will leave.



The cure of the sty is a very common one in this locality. The cure which is performed on Mondays and Thursdays is made as follows. Ten gooseberry thorns are procured and each of these is pointed in turn at the affected eye while saying the words "In the name of the Father and of the Son
(continues on next page)

4605926/4603030/4644320.title: Cure for a Sty on the Eye
4605926/4603030/4644320.text: Cure for a Sty on the Eye. 10:12:37Ten Gooseberry thorns are plucked from the bush- but- the last one must be thrown away. The remaining nine are pointed to the eye three times while the following words are being said:- In the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Ghost. Amen. This means 27 times entirely. This cure can be made on any day, provided it is done before sunset.1. Farmer2. Age: 453. Living at accompanying address now. Came from Lisgavneen.Author:Hugh Slevin,Lonaugh,Tawnylea P.OCo. Leitrim.

4649689/4647441/4650798.title: A Cure for the Stye
4649689/4647441/4650798.text: A Cure for the Stye I heard my mother Teresa Golden, Cordessy Peyton, Keshcarragan, say that this is a cure for the stye.Get ten goose - berry thorns. Throw away one of them, and point the other nine to the stye, and make the sign of the cross while doing so. Then throw away the nine thorns across your right shoulder; then put them in a place where they will rot, and in a fortnight the stye will be gone.Kileen Golden 30-11-1937

4649698/4648288/4658885.title: Cures - Stye
4649698/4648288/4658885.text:
Get ten goose-berry thorns, point nine to the Stye and throw away the tenth, keep the other nine and next cure day point eight and throw away the ninth, continue this until the thorns are gone. Cure days are Mondays and Thursdays.



Stye: Pick 10 goose-berry thorns, point nine to the eye and throw away the tenth, bury the other nine and when the thorns are withered the stye will be gone.

Stye: Pick 10 goose-berry thorns, point nine to the eye and throw away the tenth, bury the other nine and when the thorns are withered the stye will be gone.

Before starting to make the cure the person who is making it makes the sign of the cross and the person who has the stye makes the sign of the cross too. When you are  pointing each thorn to the eye you say "in the name of the Father and of  the Son and of the holy Ghost". You say that till you have the ten of them pointed to the stye. Then when you have the ten of them pointed to the stye you throw the tenth one away and bury the rest.

4701663/4690747/4706479.text:
A grass mouse must be found.  This is easy in the harvest season as many can be got in wet meadows. It is killed and then boiled in milk - fresh of course - and given unawares to person who has the complaint.It won’t do if he or she knows that the mouse has been boiled in the milk.



A sty on a person’s eye is cured in this way.  The person goes to a gooseberry bush and plucks 10 thorns.  He throws away 9 and then points the remaining one at the sty

4701699/4693662/4713454.title: Local Cures - Fever
4701699/4693662/4713454.text:
Oftentimes people take Head Fever and the man that had the cure of it in this place died a year ago and his name was Mr Thomas Kilgallon, Templeboy, Co Sligo. In this case people thought the head opened and this man measured around the person's head with his two hands and he could then tell the {leoght?} of opening. Then he put a black band around the head and prayed while doing so. When it got loose you has to tie it yourself and when you went again to him he knew if it was better. There were certain days for attending him, Mondays and Thursdays.



Oftentimes a sty comes on people's eyes. The cure of it is to get seven thorns off a gooseberry bush and point each of them once to your eye and when you have finished with them put them under a stone.

4701685/4692576/4728192.title: Local Cures - Styes
4701685/4692576/4728192.text:
(a) Pick nine thorns from a gooseberry bush & point the nine of them at the stye, & bless yourself. Do this three days & the stye will go . ( J. Sweeney).(b) Pick ten thorns from a gooseberry busy, & point them at the stye saying "In the name of the Father etc" three times over, and throwing away these thorns each time. Then throw away the tenth one unused. (V. Connolly)



Wash it with buttermilk ( A. Moffat)



Chicken- weed which is found at the damp side of a road should be boiled, a a poultice of it put on the swelling; or roast a potato & put it in  a stocking & hold it to the swelling. ( H. Conway.)



When a pice of wood sticks in a boy's leg the mother would send for the oldest woman living in the village. When this woman came, after looking at the leg, she would order the fear a' tighe to go and catch a hare and kill it, cut the tongue out & bring it it. The old woman would take the tongue & put it round the boy's leg & leave it there some time. Then she would remove it & the thorn would be in the tongue. (R.Foley)



(a) A child born after the father's daeath has a cure for this (Fr. Higgins).(b) A certain part of a goose ( J. McCormack)

4701691/4693025/4743852.title: Sleamhnáin
4701691/4693025/4743852.text: Pick ten gooseberry thorns, throw away the tenth, point the nine that are left, one by one, to the "sleamnáin" saying In the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Hold Ghost, each time you point a thorn.

4742150/4740518/4782079.title: Local Cures - Ringworm
4742150/4740518/4782079.text:
If you have ringworm get a hen and get some blood from hen foot and put it on it once. Then it will get better.



Another cure for ringworm is to a womans cring and rub it to the ringworm three times in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Ghost. This must be done three times a day for three days.The following day the ringworm will be better.



For to cure a sty you get ten gooseberry thorns and throw away one. Then you point the other nine to the sty three times a day for nine days in the name of the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Ghost. After the ninth day it will get better.

4742154/4740646/4782614.text: The cures for a sty in our eye is to pluck ten gooseberry thorns, point one to the eye each morning for nine morning throw away the tenth.

4742164/4741227/4783072.title: A Cure for Warts
4742164/4741227/4783072.text:
Some people say that if you have a wart on your finger dip your fingers in a hole in a tree, three times and it will cure it. One must not go looking for a hole in a tree. It must be found by chance.     A cure for a sty in ones eye.If a person has a sty in his eye let him get a thorn off a gooseberry bush and prod the sty nine times, counting nine in his own mind between each prod. This was told to my mother by a tramp. Told by Alfred Stranney.



If a person has a stye in his eye let him get a thorn off a gooseberry bush and prod the sty nines times, counting nine in his own mind between each prod. This was  told to my mother by a tramp.

A battle is said to have been fought in a field in Mr Thomas Dowling's land Allenwood Middle Co. Kildare in 1798. Bones, supposed to be human remains, were turned up when field was being ploughed. The English soldiers had their camp in the Dún in McNally's field now in posession of Mr. McArdle in Allenwood North.



A churndash dressed up with ribbons was put standing on kitchen floor on 31st of January. The young people went from house to house and sang and danced about the "brighdeóg".



64.A banshee follows the family of Ó Braonáin James Brennan of Gráinseach Cláir - Grangeclare West Co. Kildare and was heard recently there at the death of Bean uí bhraonáin crying at window and door. The Lyons family have also a beansidhe and also the Coynes.



To cure a sty in eye. Get 10 gooseberry thorns. Make a cross with one, throw over right shoulder and point nine others at sty in form of (on) and throw over right shoulder. Repeat three times to cure whooping - cough give some bread to the ass and collect any that falls from its mouth. Give this to sick child and then put child under and over the ass three times while ass is eating the bread. To cure whooping - cough put a necklace of hairy maggots around sufferers neck.

4742056/4731348/4815569.title: Cures - Sty in the Eye
4742056/4731348/4815569.text:
Get nine thorns from a gooseberry bush and prick the sty once with each thorn while making the sign of the cross.



Carry a small new potato around with you in your pocket. Wear red flannel next your skin.Eat plenty of new celery.Sting yourself with nettles.



CornsSoak the feet in washing soda for ten minutes rub on a little olive oil, then you easily pick them out.

Galar Truaigh - Sin galar a thagann ar ainmhidhthe. Lomann siad ar dtúais agus bíonn siad ag dul chun deiridh. Dá n-aisteareochfaí iad raghaidís i bhfeabhas.



Galar na gCos: B'in galar a thagadh ar bha agus bheithídhigh fadó. Sé an leigheas a bhíodh aca air ná na h-ainmhidhthe a thiomáint síos go dtí na portaidhthe ar feadh cúpla uair a chluig gach lá.



Nioscióidí: Leigheas ar nioscióidí iseadh meacain an dá habha a d'fhághail. Fásann an luibh sin ar bhancanna na n-abhann. Tá duilleóga beaga glasa air. Déintear í róstadh agus cuirtear leis na n-ioscióidí é nuair a bhíonn sé fuar.



Craobh-adhbhar id shúil: Sé an leigheas atá ar sin ná fáinne óir d'fhághail agus fíoghar na croise

4769976/4763660/4929035.title: Ailments and Cures - Cure for Earache
4769976/4763660/4929035.text:
Get a drop of olive-oil and a piece of wadding. Put the olive-oil upon the wadding and put it into the ear and the pain will go away. Every one does this around here for a pain in the ear.



Get a Gooseberry thorn. Point it at the sty three times. Then make the sign of the cross and throw the thorn over your right shoulder and do not look for the thorn. You have only to do this once to cure the sty. My Father told me this cure and I did it and it cured the sty.

4758583/4756592/4934931.text:
Rub with juice of a lemon.



Rub three times in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Ghost with a wedding ring.(This common in the district)Note to aboveIt must be done by "a mother" with her own wedding ring"Let" the sty with a gooseberry thron pricking it in the "name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Ghost."(Common in district)



Leavings of Ferretts food



(a) Sheep's droppings and new milk



(b) Boil bark of barbary Elm in Beer. (John Dowling Clomaitagh).(c) Crusts of loaf bread steeped in Beer for five days.The person suffering must get no other food."My mother cured myself and Pat Glendon of the jaundice with this(John Dowling, Upper Clomaitagh)

If a person has a sore eye he gets the tealeaves that are left after the tea, and puts them to it.  First, the eye is washed, and then the tealeaves are put to it, with a bandage.



If you have a sty in your eye,the old people say it will be better by looking out through a gold ring.  After looking through the ring then make a sign of the cross three times over

Anthony's Fire or Wild FireThe blood of a person names Cahill whose father and mother were both Cahill cures Anthony's Fire. A piece of thread or string is tied lightly round fingers, and the finger is then pricked with a needle. The blood is rubbed to the affected part.



SciaticaTurpentine to be taken in the following manner - Begin with one drop the first day, two drops the second, three drops the third and increasing the amount taken by one drop daily. Continue for 21 days. Then reduce the amount taken daily by one drop each day till you come back to one drop. The whole course runs over a period of 41 days

5044783/5037717/5083746.title: Cure for Styes
5044783/5037717/5083746.text: Styes are swollen tumours which sometimes come on the eyelids and which are very painful and troublesome. The doctor pronounces these as a sign of break down in general health or of a weak constitution and very likely will prescribe a wash for the eyes, or some kind of ointment. Well even these styes can be cured at home and in the following manner:-Go to a gooseberry bush and pluck from it 9 thorns, and be careful to cast away the ninth one. Then on Monday and Thursday for three times point the remaining thorns at the sore eyes, in the name of The Blessed Trinity, and by the time the cure has been made three times I'll promise you that the mischievous styes will have disappeared.Any afflicted person can make this cure effectively if they do so , with faith, and in the above manner.

5044837/5042889/5087616.title: The Cure for the Measles
5044837/5042889/5087616.text:
Another bad disease is the measles. It is like a rash on the skin and it comes when children are young. It is said that not many people escape this disease. It generally goes away after a week or so but in case of it lingering the two old cures hold good; nettle tea to be drunk every morning until the spots have disappeared. Donkey's mill is another good cure for the measles, it is also taken until the spots have been banished



Around here many are the cures that have been recorded for the forementioned bodily defects. The sufferer generally goes through the following ritual. He gets nine gooseberry thorns and points each one towards the eyes, blesses himself with it then and then throws it away across his right shoulder. He does this for nine days and then the sty is supposed to be cured

Among the Irish people there are many beliefs as to ways of curing many ills and diseases without calling a doctor. Some of them seem very natural as they consist in mixing and brewing of certain herbs, other concern charm cures and seem very silly and superstitious. There are supposed to be a great many ways of curing "warts" such as bathing them in the trough of water in the forge in which the red hot irons are cooled or by taking the froth which rises on the top of a pot of boiling potatoes and pulling it to the "warts". Another way of curing "warts" is by getting a snail and pulling in on a gooseberry thorn and then putting it on the "wart" and when the thorn rots the "wart" is supposed t rot also.

5162133/5157031/5215642.text:
Get as many pebbles as you have warts and leave them on the road and it will cure them or if you rubbed water you would get in a stone and it would cure them. To cure a sore mouth shove the child out under an asses belly. To cure ring worm rub parrifin oil to it. If a gander breathes into your mouth it will cure chin coughf . Roasted beans will cure a pain in your stomac. To stop blood leave a cobweb down on the cut.



To cure a pain in your teeth put a hairy moll up to your jaw. A dock leave will cure a burn from a nettle. If a calf had therugha-paste give him soot and salt. If a horse had a sore eye chew an ivy leaf and spit it into his eye. The smell of a burned cloth will cure a horse's cold
